New Records: Spencer Dinwiddie scored a season-high 30 points
P.J. Washington scored a season-high 28 points
Key Match Events: Sacramento's 15-2 run to take the lead
Dallas' 8-0 run to re-take the lead
Sacramento's 17-2 run to take a 10-point lead
Dallas' comeback attempt to get the lead down to 9 points
Pre-Game Insights: Dallas dared Sacramento to shoot from the outside due to their poor three-point shooting
Spencer Dinwiddie scoring 11 of Dallas' first 19 points to get them out to a 19-15 lead
Post-Match Reflections: De'Aaron Fox led Sacramento with a massive 33 points to break their six-game losing streak
Dallas' ability to get to the free-throw line was a big reason they were able to keep their offense afloat without some of their usual shot-creators
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dallas shot just 42.1% from the floor in this game, getting 24% of their points from the free-throw line
Sacramento came down with 18 offensive rebounds to Dallas' two
The Mavericks will be on the road again on Wednesday for a big game against the Rockets
